result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert C Smelcer

Jury trial on February 6, 2023 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Robert C Smelcer in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Robert C Smelcer.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin.

Pre-trial conference on August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ma] Case called at 9:50am 
Defendant Robert C Smelcer in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Michael C. Witt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Witt verifies victim rights compliance. 

Mr. Smelcer waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 9:53am  

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/31/22 at 9:00am   (2) Status Conference on 9/16/22 at 10:00am

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on July 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 8:45 AM 
Defendant Robert C Smelcer in court.  Michael C. Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon inquiry of the Court, Mr. Smelcer indicates that he applied at public defenders office and does qualify. 

Atty Rumpf(Public Defender Office Manager) asserts that Mr. Smelcer is eligible, office is actively attempting to appoint counsel for Mr. Smelcer. 

recess:8:50am 
NEXT: Status of Counsel on 7/15/22 at 9:30am

Pre-trial conference on June 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ae] case called 10:40 AM Defendant Robert C Smelcer in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1,000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Victim 1
--not to accept any money as a downpayment for a contracting job
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 10:45am
NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on  6/8/22 at 11 am  (2) Preliminary Hearing on 7/1/22 at 8:30 am
